results.abstract: Major partners in International Space Station release guidelines dictating who can visit the outpost; tourists and other nonastronauts are welcome, but not if they are drug abusers, alcoholics or guilty of 'notoriously disgraceful conduct' (M)

headline.main: Rules Are Set on Who Is Fit to Visit Space Station

results.snippet: Partners in the International Space Station released guidelines today dictating who could visit the outpost: tourists and other nonastronauts are welcome, but not if they are drug abusers, alcoholics or guilty of ''notoriously disgraceful conduct.'' ...
results.lead_paragraph: Partners in the International Space Station released guidelines today dictating who could visit the outpost: tourists and other nonastronauts are welcome, but not if they are drug abusers, alcoholics or guilty of ''notoriously disgraceful conduct.'' The five major partners in the project, made up of the space agencies of the United States, Russia, Canada, Japan and Europe, released a nine-page document that they said had been in the works for two years.

results.abstract: Specialty summer camps, once restricted to sports and arts, now allow children from grade school to high school pursue all sorts of interests; photos (M)

headline.main: Personal Business; Specialty Camps Can Stretch Minds (and Wallets)

results.snippet: ALAYNA SPRATLEY, 16, spent last summer salvaging the wreckage of an 1820 Mexican Army supply ship off the North Carolina coast. Eeman Ouyoun, 10, helped produce a digital movie, while Jonathan Mendelson, 17, investigated alternative fuels during a...
results.lead_paragraph: ALAYNA SPRATLEY, 16, spent last summer salvaging the wreckage of an 1820 Mexican Army supply ship off the North Carolina coast. Eeman Ouyoun, 10, helped produce a digital movie, while Jonathan Mendelson, 17, investigated alternative fuels during a visit to Biosphere 2 near Tucson. Summer camp isn't just about campfires and canoeing any more. An array of sophisticated programs offers children from grade school to high school things like filmmaking or investing, computer science or marine science. Some offer community service in faraway places; others provide college-level courses that students can take at their local campuses. (So much for a vacation from homework and report cards.)

results.abstract: Americans win three top spots in halfpipe snowboarding event, giving US its first sweep in Winter Games since 1956; Ross Powers is gold medalist; Danny Kass wins silver and J J Thomas takes bronze; photos (M)
results.snippet: There is a mountain in southern Vermont where the legend of a certain 23-year-old snowboarder is as large as the snowdrifts. Riders and instructors there talk about how Ross Powers learned to ride on the icy slopes of Stratton Mountain on a...
results.lead_paragraph: There is a mountain in southern Vermont where the legend of a certain 23-year-old snowboarder is as large as the snowdrifts. Riders and instructors there talk about how Ross Powers learned to ride on the icy slopes of Stratton Mountain on a scholarship, how his mother supported the family by working in the cafeteria of a nearby resort, how he competed in the United States Open within a few years of getting his first snowboard at age 7. Powers, one of the early stars in the fad-obsessed world of snowboarding, has been hailed as a hero of the young sport by industry magazines, his Olympic teammates and many of the European and Japanese riders competing here at the 19th Winter Games.

results.abstract: Mae C Jemison, doctor and former astronaut, says her cat is potent symbol of home for her; photo (Special Section, Nesting) (S)

headline.main: Objects of Affection: A Rug, a Pot, a Cat, a Cross

results.snippet: It may be an abstract masterpiece by an impossibly hip artist, a daughter's nursery-school finger painting, a quilt made by Grandma or an overstuffed chair picked up at a fire sale. Whatever the special item is, it connotes warmth and comfort and...
results.lead_paragraph: It may be an abstract masterpiece by an impossibly hip artist, a daughter's nursery-school finger painting, a quilt made by Grandma or an overstuffed chair picked up at a fire sale. Whatever the special item is, it connotes warmth and comfort and well-being -- and says ''home.'' In that spirit, these people were asked about that certain something. KIMBERLY STEVENS Mae C. Jemison Doctor and Former Astronaut When I was a doctor in Sierra Leone working for the Peace Corps, I got a kitten from a family whose child was allergic to it. The kitten's name was Sneeze and Fleas, and he went everywhere with me. He was white with touches of silver and gray, and used to sit at the table with me. When I first got him he was eating the local foods, which were spicy sauces and stews over rice.

results.abstract: Profile of Toby Bright, new head of commercial airplane sales at Boeing Co, who confronts most dramatic downturn in aviation history; commercial airplanes accounted for $35 billion of Boeing's $58 billion in sales in 2001, and that proportion is now expected to shrink sharply; photo (M)

headline.main: Private Sector; Selling Airplanes With a Smile

results.snippet: FEW jobs seem more challenging after Sept. 11 than selling commercial airplanes. In the teeth of the most dramatic downturn in aviation history, most of the world's airlines are trying to put off paying for the new jets they had on order, much less...
results.lead_paragraph: FEW jobs seem more challenging after Sept. 11 than selling commercial airplanes. In the teeth of the most dramatic downturn in aviation history, most of the world's airlines are trying to put off paying for the new jets they had on order, much less buy new ones. But Toby Bright, recently named to lead commercial airplane sales at the Boeing Company, is philosophical. ''It's going to be tough, but on the other hand, it can only go one direction,'' he said. ''It can't get any worse.''

results.abstract: Astronaut Bonnie Dunbar will talk to students of New York City's Brearley School about future of human space travel, in hope of broadening students' interest in science; photo (S)
results.snippet: BONNIE DUNBAR, an astronaut who took part in five space missions, will talk to the students of the Brearley School today about future human space travel. Brearley, a selective girls' private school on the Upper East Side, hopes that the presence of...
results.lead_paragraph: BONNIE DUNBAR, an astronaut who took part in five space missions, will talk to the students of the Brearley School today about future human space travel. Brearley, a selective girls' private school on the Upper East Side, hopes that the presence of Dr. Dunbar, a member of the first United States shuttle crew to dock with the Russian space station, Mir, will encourage its students toward careers in science. Brearley has recently renovated its science labs, and a senior of the school, ARIANE ISABELLE TSCHUMI, is a semifinalist in this year's Intel Science Talent Search.
